security
WSTG-INPV
inpv-01-xss-stored.test.js
VULNERABLE: Todo input accepts and stores XSS payload: <script>alert(1)</script>
VULNERABLE: Todo input accepts and stores XSS payload:
VULNERABLE: Todo input accepts and stores XSS payload: <svg onload=alert(1)>
VULNERABLE: innerHTML renders todo text without sanitization
Security Recommendation: textContent should be used instead of innerHTML
VULNERABLE: Order stores shipping info without sanitization
Search input value is used in filter without sanitization
VULNERABLE: User profile displayName accepts HTML
Document: Multiple innerHTML usage locations identified
FIXED: escapeHTML properly escapes script tags
FIXED: escapeHTML properly escapes img onerror
FIXED: escapeHTML properly escapes svg onload
FIXED: escapeHTML handles all special characters
FIXED: escapeHTML handles single quotes
FIXED: escapeHTML handles null and undefined
FIXED: escapeHTML preserves normal text
FIXED: escapeHTML handles Japanese text
FIXED: escapeHTML neutralizes XSS payload: <script>alert(1)</script>
FIXED: escapeHTML neutralizes XSS payload:
FIXED: escapeHTML neutralizes XSS payload: <svg onload=alert(1)>
inpv-02-xss-dom-based.test.js
innerHTML with user-controlled data creates XSS risk
Safe alternative: textContent does not execute scripts
Safe alternative: createElement + textContent pattern
GOOD: document.write is not used in application
GOOD: eval is not used in application
URL parameters are not directly rendered without sanitization

Event handler payload should not execute:
hover me
Event handler payload should not execute: <input onfocus="alert(1)" autofocus>
Event handler payload should not execute: <video><source onerror="alert(1)">
Event handler payload should not execute:
DOMPurify-like sanitization removes dangerous elements
Attribute encoding prevents attribute injection
WSTG-CONF
conf-02-error-handling.test.js
Invalid product ID does not throw errors
Empty string input is handled
Invalid login credentials do not expose internal errors
Corrupted localStorage handling
Missing localStorage items are handled
GOOD: Source code should not contain sensitive comments
Error messages do not reveal system information
Check for debug flags in source code
Check for verbose console logging
Document: Recommended error handling pattern
Document: Try-catch wrapper pattern
Document: Recommended window.onerror handler
Document: Recommended unhandledrejection handler
conf-01-cdn-integrity.test.js
Document CDN stylesheets SRI status
Check external scripts for SRI attributes
FIXED: Font Awesome has SRI attributes
Example: Correct SRI implementation
Document: Why SRI is important
Example: Generate SRI hash format
Document: Recommended Content-Security-Policy
All external resources should use HTTPS
WSTG-BUSL
busl-02-checkout-bypass.test.js
Empty cart can be verified
VULNERABILITY: Orders can be created with empty cart via localStorage
VULNERABILITY: Invalid email format accepted in orders
VULNERABILITY: Orders can be created with empty shipping info
VULNERABILITY: Order total can be set to any value
VULNERABILITY: Invalid payment method can be stored
VULNERABILITY: Fake orders can be injected
Order validation function should check all fields
busl-01-cart-manipulation.test.js
VULNERABILITY: Cart prices can be tampered via localStorage
VULNERABILITY: Negative quantity can be set
Cart total reflects tampered prices
VULNERABILITY: Non-existent product ID can be added
VULNERABILITY: Extremely large quantity can be set
Cart accessible without authentication
Server-side validation pattern
WSTG-SESS.sess-01-session-management.test.js
VULNERABILITY: No session token - uses localStorage JSON object only
VULNERABILITY: Session can be created without authentication
VULNERABILITY: Session identifier does not change after login
VULNERABILITY: No session token randomness
GOOD: Logout clears currentUser
PARTIAL: User data may persist after logout
Logout is accessible from UI
VULNERABILITY: No session timeout implemented
Multiple "sessions" share same localStorage
Example: Session with expiration
Example: Secure session token generation
Example: Logout with full cleanup
WSTG-CLNT
clnt-01-localstorage-security.test.js
VULNERABILITY: All data stored in localStorage persists indefinitely
Data persists across browser sessions
VULNERABILITY: localStorage data is not encrypted
VULNERABILITY: Any JavaScript can modify localStorage
Invalid JSON in localStorage handling
localStorage changes affect all tabs
VULNERABILITY: Order history with PII can be stored
VULNERABILITY: User preferences stored without protection
Large data can be stored (potential DoS vector)
Example: Data integrity check pattern
Example: Session-based storage pattern
clnt-02-clickjacking.test.js
FIXED: index.html has clickjacking protection
FIXED: user-profile.html has clickjacking protection
Login button could be clickjacked
Checkout button could be clickjacked
Add to cart buttons could be clickjacked
Example: JavaScript frame busting code
Example: CSP frame-ancestors meta tag
Example: Detecting if page is framed
Example: Visual frame detection warning
Document: HTTP headers for clickjacking protection
WSTG-ATHN
athn-02-password-storage.test.js
GOOD: Password is NOT stored in localStorage after login
currentUser storage does not contain password
VULNERABILITY: PII can be stored in plaintext localStorage
localStorage is accessible via JavaScript
VULNERABILITY: No session token - relies on localStorage flag
Session can be hijacked by modifying localStorage
GOOD: Logout clears currentUser
Data may persist after logout (by design)
athn-01-credentials.test.js
VULNERABILITY: Application uses hardcoded credentials
Source code contains plaintext password
Invalid username is rejected
Invalid password is rejected
Empty credentials are rejected
SQL injection in credentials does not cause errors
GOOD: Same error for invalid username and invalid password
VULNERABILITY: No rate limiting or lockout mechanism
VULNERABILITY: Weak password accepted
